item.title: Unemployment
item.description: This course presents a matching model of unemployment and uses it to study unemployment fluctuations, job rationing, and labor market policies.

item.title: A Macroeconomic Approach to Optimal Unemployment Insurance: Applications
item.description: This paper studies how the generosity of unemployment insurance should vary over the business cycle in the United States. Published in AEJ Policy, 2018.

item.title: Aggregate Demand, Idle Time, and Unemployment
item.description: This paper develops a model of unemployment fluctuations in which the labor and product markets have a matching structure. Published in QJE, 2015.
